```{r Multiplot, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
# multiple scatterplots, with confidence intervals, in a single html page

#creating plot titles and axes labels
f <- list(size = 18, color = "black") # family = "Verdana",

title_p1 <- list(text      = "Raw data",
                 font      = f,
                 xref      = "Phenotype",
                 yref      = "Annotation term frequency",
                 yanchor   = "bottom",
                 xanchor   = "center",
                 align     = "center",
                 x         = 0.5,
                 y         = 1,
                 showarrow = FALSE)

title_p2      <- title_p1
title_p2$text <- "Rank data"
title_p2$xref <- "Phenotype rank"
title_p2$yref <- "Annotation term frequency rank"

title_p3      <- title_p1
title_p3$text <- "Phylogeny-aware linear model data"
title_p3$xref <- "Contrasts of phenotypes"
title_p3$yref <- "Contrasts of annotation term frequencies"

# TODO: multicore-parallelize this for loop.
for (i in seq_along(df_cutoff$name)){#df_cutoff$name[1:length(df_cutoff[, 1])]) { # get filtered to plot a lot
  
  fname <- df_cutoff$name[i]
  
  #output dir
  file <- paste0(cpd, fname, ".html")
  
  # setting up data
  Xdf         <- defs$x
  names(Xdf)  <- "X_var"
  Xdf$feature <- defs$y[, fname] / defs$denominator
  ID          <- row.names(Xdf)
  
  p1 <- ggplot2::ggplot(data    = Xdf, 
                        mapping = ggplot2::aes(x     = X_var, 
                                               y     = feature,
                                               label = ID)) + 
    ggplot2::geom_point() +
    #    expand_limits(x = 0, y = 0) +
    ggplot2::geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = y ~ x, se = TRUE) + 
    ggplot2::theme_bw() +
    ggplot2::labs(x = "Phenotype value", 
                  y = "Annotation frequency")
  
  Xdf           <- as.data.frame(rank(defs$x[, 1]))
  rownames(Xdf) <- rownames(defs$x)
  names(Xdf)    <- "X_var"
  Xdf$feature   <- rank(defs$y[, fname] / defs$denominator)
  
    p2 <- ggplot2::ggplot(data    = Xdf, 
                        mapping = ggplot2::aes(x     = X_var, 
                                               y     = feature,
                                               label = ID)) + 
    ggplot2::geom_point() +
    ggplot2::geom_smooth(method = "loess", formula = y ~ x, se = TRUE) + 
    ggplot2::theme_bw() +
    ggplot2::labs(x = "Phenotype rank", 
                  y = "Annotation frequency rank")
  
  # TODO: plots only consider "pic". If we implement "gls", maybe we'll need to 
  # change something here too.
  tmp_x        <- defs$x[, 1]
  names(tmp_x) <- rownames(defs$x)
  contrast_x   <- ape::pic(x = tmp_x, phy = defs$tree)
  
  tmp_y        <- defs$y[, fname] / defs$denominator
  names(tmp_y) <- rownames(defs$x)
  contrast_y   <- ape::pic(x = tmp_y, phy = defs$tree)
  
  Xdf   <- data.frame(contrast_x, contrast_y)
  model <- stats::lm(contrast_y ~ contrast_x + 0)
  
  p3 <- ggplot2::ggplot(data    = Xdf, 
                        mapping = ggplot2::aes(x     = contrast_x, 
                                               y     = contrast_y, 
                                               label = rownames(Xdf))) +
    ggplot2::geom_point() +
    ggplot2::geom_abline(slope     = model$coefficients[1], 
                         intercept = 0, 
                         color     = c("#3366FFFF"), 
                         size      = 1) +
    ggplot2::theme_bw() +
    ggplot2::labs(x = "contrasts for phenotype", 
                  y = "Contrasts for annotation frequency")
  #             ggplot2::geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  #    ggplot2::geom_line(data = fortify(model), aes(x = contrast_x, y = .fitted))
  #             ggtitle(paste0("phylogeny-aware linear model data for "), i),
  #    ggtitle("Representation of raw data             Representation of rank data                Representation of phylogenetic-aware linear model data")
  
  p4 <- plotly::subplot(p1, p2, p3, shareX = TRUE, shareY = FALSE)
  
  p1ly <- plotly::ggplotly(p4,
                           tooltip = c('label','X_var','Normalized feature'))
  
  htmlwidgets::saveWidget(p1ly, file = file,
                          libdir = 'lib',
                          selfcontained = FALSE)
}
```

```{r Boxplot, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE}

for (i in seq_along(df_cutoff$name)){
  
  fname <- df_cutoff$name[i]
  
  #output dir
  file <- paste0(cpd, fname, '_boxplot', ".html")

  plot_title <- paste0(fname, " - ", defs$annotation.cor[fname])

  file_name <- paste0(fname, "_boxplot_per_group", ".pdf")

  file_name <- gsub(":", "_", file_name)

  tmp <- data.frame(defs$x, defs$short.name, defs$groups, defs$y[fname], (defs$y[fname]/defs$denominator))

  colnames(tmp) <- c("cell_type", "short", "group", "count", "norm")

#  tmp$group[tmp$group=="Metazoa(chordate)"] <- c("Metazoa\n(chordate)")
#  tmp$group[tmp$group=="Metazoa(non-chordate)"] <- c("Metazoa\n(non-chordate)")

  p1 = ggplot2::ggplot(tmp, ggplot2::aes(x=reorder(group, count, FUN = median), y=count)) + ggplot2::geom_boxplot(ggplot2::aes(fill = factor(group))) + ggplot2::theme(axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), axis.title.x = ggplot2::element_blank())
  
  
  #code below forces y axis limit to zero, do y log scale transformation and adds a new color palette. Uncomment it if you wish to add these features, but:

  #2) the palette from scale_fill_brewer works for three or more groups only
  #+ ggplot2::expand_limits(y = 0) + ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0))
  #+ ggplot2::scale_y_log10()
  #+ ggplot2::stat_summary(fun = "median", geom="errorbar", width=0.8, color="black") 
  #+ ggplot2::geom_violin(ggplot2::aes(fill = factor(group))) 
  #+ ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1")

  p2 = ggplot2::ggplot(tmp, ggplot2::aes(x=reorder(group, norm, FUN = median), y=norm)) + ggplot2::geom_boxplot(ggplot2::aes(fill = factor(group))) + ggplot2::theme(axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), axis.title.x = ggplot2::element_blank())
  
  #+ ggplot2::expand_limits(y = 0) + ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0))
  #+ ggplot2::scale_y_log10()
  #+ ggplot2::stat_summary(fun = "median", geom="errorbar", width=0.8, color="black") 
  #+ ggplot2::geom_violin(ggplot2::aes(fill = factor(group))) 
  #+ ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1")
  
#  p1 = ggplot2::ggplot(tmp, aes(x=reorder(group, count, FUN = median), y=count, fill = group)) + geom_violin(trim = FALSE) + geom_jitter(position=position_jitter(0.2)) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45), axis.title.x = element_blank()) + scale_y_log10() + scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1")

#  p2 = ggplot2::ggplot(tmp, aes(x=reorder(group, norm, FUN = median), y=norm, fill = group)) + geom_violin(trim = FALSE) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45), axis.title.x = element_blank()) + scale_y_log10() + scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1")

  #p1 = ggplot(tmp, aes(x=group, y=value, fill = group)) + geom_boxplot() + scale_y_continuous(trans='log10')

  #p2 = ggplot(tmp, aes(x=group, y=norm, fill = group)) + geom_boxplot()  + scale_y_continuous(trans='log10')

  legend_b <- cowplot::get_legend(p1 + ggplot2::theme(legend.position="top"))

  prow <- plotly::subplot(p1, p2, shareX = TRUE, shareY = FALSE)

  title <- cowplot::ggdraw() +
    cowplot::draw_label(
      plot_title,
      fontface = 'bold',
      x = 0,
      hjust = 0
    ) +
    ggplot2::theme(
      # add margin on the left of the drawing canvas,
      # so title is aligned with left edge of first plot
      plot.margin = ggplot2::margin(0, 0, 0, 7)
    )
  
  p3 <- plotly::ggplotly(prow)
  
  htmlwidgets::saveWidget(p3,
                          file = file,
                          libdir = 'lib',
                          selfcontained = FALSE
```
